scenario.situation: A few players are playing a boardgame. The current state of the game is as follows. The chinchilla destroys the wall constructed by the owl. The cobra has four friends. The cobra does not refuse to help the camel. And the rules of the game are as follows. Rule1: If something calls the starling, then it invests in the company whose owner is the coyote, too. Rule2: If there is evidence that one animal, no matter which one, destroys the wall built by the owl, then the cobra is not going to reveal a secret to the goose. Rule3: If something does not fall on a square that belongs to the fangtooth and additionally not reveal a secret to the goose, then it will not invest in the company whose owner is the coyote. Rule4: Here is an important piece of information about the cobra: if it has more than 10 friends then it does not call the starling for sure. Rule5: The cobra will reveal something that is supposed to be a secret to the goose if it (the cobra) has a card whose color appears in the flag of Belgium. Rule6: The cobra will not call the starling if it (the cobra) is in France at the moment. Rule7: If you are positive that one of the animals does not refuse to help the camel, you can be certain that it will call the starling without a doubt. Rule3 is preferred over Rule1. Rule4 is preferred over Rule7. Rule5 is preferred over Rule2. Rule6 is preferred over Rule7.

scenario.situation: A few players are playing a boardgame. The current state of the game is as follows. The dolphin has 16 dollars. The dove has 50 dollars, has a 18 x 14 inches notebook, and is watching a movie from 1991. The dove invented a time machine. The mermaid has 19 dollars. The butterfly does not surrender to the mermaid. The stork does not tear down the castle that belongs to the mermaid. And the rules of the game are as follows. Rule1: The dove will call the bison if it (the dove) is watching a movie that was released before Lionel Messi was born. Rule2: If the butterfly does not surrender to the mermaid and the stork does not tear down the castle of the mermaid, then the mermaid falls on a square of the dove. Rule3: Regarding the dove, if it has a card whose color starts with the letter "b", then we can conclude that it calls the bison. Rule4: The living creature that does not swear to the gorilla will never fall on a square of the dove. Rule5: The dove will not call the bison if it (the dove) has a notebook that fits in a 23.5 x 17.3 inches box. Rule6: The dove will not smile at the otter if it (the dove) purchased a time machine. Rule7: If something does not smile at the otter and additionally not call the bison, then it enjoys the companionship of the peafowl. Rule8: One of the rules of the game is that if the mermaid falls on a square that belongs to the dove, then the dove will never enjoy the company of the peafowl. Rule9: Regarding the dove, if it has more money than the mermaid and the dolphin combined, then we can conclude that it does not smile at the otter. Rule1 is preferred over Rule5. Rule3 is preferred over Rule5. Rule4 is preferred over Rule2. Rule7 is preferred over Rule8.

scenario.situation: A few players are playing a boardgame. The current state of the game is as follows. The dolphin has 16 dollars. The dove has 50 dollars, has a 18 x 14 inches notebook, and is watching a movie from 1991. The dove invented a time machine. The mermaid has 19 dollars. The butterfly does not surrender to the mermaid. The stork does not tear down the castle that belongs to the mermaid. And the rules of the game are as follows. Rule1: The dove will call the bison if it (the dove) is watching a movie that was released before Lionel Messi was born. Rule2: If the butterfly does not surrender to the mermaid and the stork does not tear down the castle of the mermaid, then the mermaid falls on a square of the dove. Rule3: Regarding the dove, if it has a card whose color starts with the letter "b", then we can conclude that it calls the bison. Rule4: The living creature that does not swear to the gorilla will never fall on a square of the dove. Rule5: The dove will not call the bison if it (the dove) has a notebook that fits in a 23.5 x 17.3 inches box. Rule6: The dove will not smile at the otter if it (the dove) purchased a time machine. Rule7: If something does not smile at the otter and additionally not call the bison, then it enjoys the companionship of the peafowl. Rule8: One of the rules of the game is that if the mermaid falls on a square that belongs to the dove, then the dove will never enjoy the company of the peafowl. Rule9: Regarding the dove, if it has more money than the mermaid and the dolphin combined, then we can conclude that it does not smile at the otter. Rule1 is preferred over Rule5. Rule3 is preferred over Rule5. Rule4 is preferred over Rule2. Rule7 is preferred over Rule8.
